Our admirals see great potential for expanding our influence in East Asia. After an expedition to Japan, some of our sailors docked in Keelung, on the Chinese island of Formosa (known in Chinese as Taiwan), to inspect coal deposits and assess their potential for mining. They report that the island is both highly lucrative and easy to defend, making it a perfect colony. It would also counteract the expansion of European markets in Asia--putting us more prominently on the world stage.

Our countless internal rebellions over this century prove how quickly our authority disintegrates when challenged. In Taiwan particularly, our administration fails to reign in the local populace, leaving the Taiwanese aboriginals free to live on their tribal land under no Chinese jurisdiction. \n\nWe have dispatched an expedition to forcibly bring civilization to the aboriginals, encountering resistance from the Paiwan tribesmen around Shizi Township and Pingtung County, but ultimately winning an overwhelming victory. A new construction project to solidify a Qing presence in Taiwan has been begun, greatly hindering any attempt by a colonizing country to erase the fact that Taiwan will forever be culturally Chinese.

Taiwan's population is a mix of immigrants from across southern China, with people from different provinces taking on different identities in Taiwanese society. Normally these groups do not experience ethnic tension, but the residents of Mengjia, primarily Minnan immigrants from Quanzhou, now find themselves resistant to building community with new residents moving from nearby Bajiazhuang, who are mostly immigrants from Tong'an. Tensions have escalated between the two over tribalistic community identity. For example, Mengjia residents worship their own patron god at the local temple, whom the Tong'an migrants reject. The two also have competed for docking rights at Mengjia Wharf to trade with the mainland. Soon enough this tension erupted into gang-like violence. Bajiazhuang was burnt down in a riot, and its former residents in Mengjia have been pushed out to settle in Dadaocheng, another coastal suburb.

After four Ryukyuan tributary ships departed from Okinawa, a typhoon caused the ships to change course and led to one being wrecked off western Taiwan, leaving 66 survivors. These men found themselves heading into the territory of the Paiwan aboriginals of Taiwan, where they were robbed and executed. Only twelve survived--they managed to hide from their attackers and were later brought back to the Ryukyus to testify to our government about the incident. How shall we respond?

After four Ryukyuan tributary ships departed from Okinawa, a typhoon caused the ships to change course and led to one being wrecked off western Taiwan, leaving 66 sailors stranded. These men found themselves heading into the territory of the Paiwan aboriginals of Taiwan, where they were robbed and executed. Only twelve survived--they managed to hide from their attackers and were later brought back to the Ryukyus.\n\nJapan is demanding compensation for these sailors' deaths, despite how the Ryukyus are not Japanese territories and, in fact, are one of our tributaries. Additionally, our administration has made little effort to bring the Taiwanese aboriginals under Chinese rule, and they can therefore be dismissed as outside our state's control--eliminating our need to take responsibility. Nevertheless, how should we respond to Japan?

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to compensate us for the sailors' deaths. This historic occasion marks the first time that China has bowed to Japan. By agreeing to our demands, they have shown their weakness in comparison to our rapidly modernizing army and navy. Maybe one day soon we will be able to wrest Taiwan from China's grasp.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to compensate us for the sailors' deaths. They assert that, as non-Han subjects of living in isolated tribal land, they are "outside the realm of civilization." Therefore, the Chinese state exerts no control over them and cannot be held responsible for their actions. Perhaps we must make them pay at gunpoint?
Despite their anger at our refusal to pay an indemnity, Japan does not wish to escalate this incident to war. We respect their decision--it certainly was a smart one.

Japan has declared war over our refusal to pay an indemnity over the 54 executed Ryukyuan sailors. It seems they will have the whole island of Taiwan before they let China off for these aborigines' crimes.

Today, Qing troops led by Lin Zexu marched over to Heicuo Temple, a Tibetan Buddhist temple in Amdo, to crush an anti-Qing rebel group congregating there. The soldiers worked with unfettered brutality: they burnt the temple to the ground, raized the nearby village, and massacred rebels and civilians alike. We will watch with anticipation how the everpresent Tibetan resistance reacts to this event--and their realization of how easily their resistance to the Qing's might crumbles.

Under the guidance of administrator Lin Zexu, Qing officials are beginning a confiscation of all opium trafficked on the Pearl River bank in Humen, Dongguan. The confiscation has already drawn up several hundred tons of opium unloaded from British cargo ships. \n\nThe Emperor has ordered that every person caught partaking in the opium trade in China shall be executed. With the side effects of the drug being so severe, including death from withdrawal, it is the least we can do right this injustice.

Following a treaty between between us for the joint suppression of the slave trade, the United States and Britain have started pressuring our government to outlaw slavery. Refusing would severely endanger our centuries-long alliance with the British.

During an average monthly rainfall 150% above normal in the state, Vermont has been hit by a flood that is engulfing much of its buildings and streets. The flood also has destroyed infrastructure that the state government has failed to provide funds to repair, creating tension between local politicians and residents. It is estimated that Vermont's towns received on average more than six inches of rain during the flood so far. Somerset is bearing the worst, at one point experiencing a whopping 9.86 inches on record.

The Croatian politician Eugen Kvaternik, founder of the nationalist Party of Rights, was executed today for inciting a rebellion to liberate Croatia from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. After marching with sympathizers through villages such as Rakovica, Brocanac, and Dreznik, Kvaternik led an attack on the guarded village of Plaski to create a contiguous line of Croatian land that would join his independence movement. In response, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government sent in a regiment to deal with the rebels, promptly arresting Kvaternik and other high-level participants. Such is the fate of nationalist movements in large empires: they hit hard, then fall harder.

As if the feud between Britain and its brutally subjugated domain of Ireland could not get worse, America itself has been caught in the fray. An Irish Republican terrorist group called the Fenian Brotherhood, consisting of Irish-American immigrants, launched incursions into Canada to attack British Army forts, attempting to pressure us to withdraw from their homeland. Several raids were launched in Canada East, Canada West, and New Brunswick by the Fenian Brotherhood, though each failed to push out our troops entirely. These radicals are willing to start a guerrilla war and drag the United States into it by having it serve as their home of operations. It's certainly a relief that they are too incompetent to actually accomplish their goal.

With the Wehrgesetz (Defence Act) being extended to the mountainous region of Krivošije, north of Kotor, fighting has broken out between our troops and the tribesmen inhabiting the area. With help from their compatriots in Montenegro and some bands from Herzegovina, the Krivošije rebels have defeated the several detachments sent against them, humiliating the army and strengthening the rebels' resolve. The conflict has been resolved via a peace treaty, which was signed at Knežlaz, with the rebels officially surrendering to General Rodic but being allowed to keep their weapons and pardoned for their revolt. With the conscription intended by the Wehrgesetz abandoned, the campaign has brought us nothing but humiliation.

American business interests have offered to buy the remote northern reaches of our realm in exchange for a hefty sum. They seek to develop the region into a colony. Should we accept their offer and give them the Api region?

Two American businessmen, Joseph Torrey and Thomas Harris, have erected a small farming colony along the coast of the remote island of Borneo. Named the “Ellena Colony," it aims to make a profit through the export of sugarcane. However, the spread of tropical diseases such as malaria through the colony have spelled financial disaster, and its owners seek to sell it. Although it is a significant investment, an American presence in the East Indies could have its rewards...

German adventurer and businessman Baron von Overbeck has offered us the chance to purchase a large and remote colony on the northern coast of Borneo. Acquired from a failed American venture and purchases from the sultanates of Sulu and Brunei, Overbeck's colony certainly has some strategic and economic importance, but its remote location is worrying, and local cooperation is unlikely...

A local chieftain by the name of Mat Salleh has taken up arms against our colonial ambitions in northern Borneo. Rallying tribesmen, pirates, and other local chiefs to his rebellion, he has achieved a wide degree of support among the native population.

The famed chieftain and resistance fighter Mat Salleh has been defeated by our colonial forces in Borneo. After years of harassing and attacking our colonial infrastructure, the region is finally in a relative peace and resistance to our rule has crumbled.
Our influence over the Sulu Sultanate is weakening with the purchase of a foreign colony in northeast Borneo. We must reassert our claims to Sabah, or reach a deal to resolve the situation.

The Spanish have raised a dispute with our new colony in North Borneo, saying that much of it falls under the influence of their allied Sultanate of Sulu. They have offered us a deal: in return for recognizing Spanish control over Sulu, they will give up claim to the territory.
$FROM$ has recognized our claims over the Sulu Sultanate. In return, we have given up our claims in North Borneo.
$FROM$ has refused to accept our claims over the Sulu Sultanate! Our colonial administration is demanding war to defend our territory and influence in the region.

The island of Malta in the Mediterranean Sea is immensely geostrategically valuable to us. Along with Gibraltar, it ensures us a safe port in the Mediterranean on the route to the Suez canal to India. The construction of a line of fortifications between the populated Southeast of the island and the more hilly, defensible Northwest has been proposed. They would be dubbed 'The Victoria Lines', named after our beloved queen.

Spurred on by the Great Awakening in the United States, many devout preachers have come to our kingdom and inspired a tremendous rise in religious fervor. The initially small congregations established in the 1810s and 20s have seen massive turnouts, large scale baptisms and prayers have begun, and islanders have reported holy miracles and visions. The great Christian awakening has truly taken hold in Hawai'i.

God hath made of one blood all nations of men to dwell on the earth, in unity and blessedness. God has also bestowed certain rights alike on all men and all chiefs, and all people of all lands. These are some of the rights which He has given alike to every man and every chief of correct deportment
French: life, limb, liberty, freedom from oppression
German: the earnings of his hands and the productions of his mind, not however to those who act in violation of the laws.” \nKing Kamehameha III has issued a declaration of the rights inherent to the citizens of Hawai'i. Inspired by the republicanism and constitutional monarchies of the western powers, old traditions of absolute rule have begun to fade.

English: “The hideous immensity itself, independent of the many frightful images which it embraced, almost caused an involuntary closing of the eyes against it. But when to the sight is added the appalling effect of the various unnatural and fearful noises, the muttering and sighing, the groaning and blowing, the every agonized struggling, of the mighty action within, as a whole, it is too horrible. And for the first moment I felt like one of my friends, who, on reaching the brink, recoiled, and covered his face, exclaiming, ‘Call it weakness, or what you please, but I cannot look again.'” - Stewart's Journal of a Residence in the Sandwich Islands \nA great eruption of the volcano Kilauea has occurred, sending ash into the sky for twenty six days and nights, and reportedly allowing newspapers to be read by night as far away as Hilo.

As our nation begins to modernize, our king has decided that it is high time to adopt a formal written constitution of our laws and government. It shall be written in a manner that allows for the common people to have some choice in government, while still giving the majority of the power to the king.

Until now, our population has mostly relied on traditional means of exchange or foreign currency for economic activity. However, the Kingdom has recently issued a number of coins bearing the face of our king, representing the new “Hawaiian Dollar.”

Although colonial diseases have been endemic ever since our first contact with the Europeans, an outbreak of measles has spread throughout the islands at an alarming rate, killing mainly native Hawaiians. The devastation has brought rural life to its knees, and allowed for plantations to acquire more land from dead and dying villages. \nIn time, the pandemic may clear, but for now measles rules Hawai'i.

A strange religious movement has spread to Hawai'i. Missionaries from the Church of Latter Day Saints, colloquially known as “Mormons,” have settled in our kingdom. Although Christian, they have faced great persecution for their divergent beliefs from the rest of Protestant Christianity. Despite this, they have received some accolades for their actions.

The old land management system of ancient times has grown inadequate for our modernizing nation. The arrival of plantations, mills, and industry has clashed with our past system of communal land ownership. We will privatize much of this land, and allow it to be sold to private and foreign interests in order to develop our kingdom.

With war and strife taking hold of China, many laborers have come to Hawai'i to seek refuge and employment. Plantation owners and industrialists will no doubt make use of their labor, especially as the native population declines from decades of disease.

Although the 1840 Constitution made great strides to the modernization of our kingdom, we still lag behind the governments of the western powers. Inspired by British and American administration, we shall reform into a proper constitutional monarchy and guarantee suffrage to all.

Today is a tragic day for our kingdom. The King of the Hawaiian Islands, Kamehameha III, has suddenly passed at the age of forty. Seen as the great modernizer of the Kingdom, many will mourn his passing. His young adopted son and nephew shall rule as King Kamehameha IV.

Disease has ravaged our kingdom for decades and killed perhaps half of the native population of our islands. Our king, following a proposal from an American physician, has declared the construction of a grand hospital in our capital in order to halt the spread of disease.

In order to protect and maintain internal order in our kingdom, the King has declared the foundation of a new military unit, comprised of Western soldiers, officers, and equipment. These “Honolulu Rifles” shall be the elite troops of our proud army.\n\n§RWarning: You have to merge the brigades that are generated by this decision§W

“Ke Akua Mana Mau, Ho'omaika'i, pomaika'i, I ka mo'i .” \nSince the time of Kamehameha I, our kingdom has traditionally used the British “God Save the King” as our royal anthem. However, the English anthem has sparked some concerns over the abandonment of our native tongue. In recognition of this, Prince Lunalilo has penned a translation of the tune into the native Hawaiian tongue to be used in its place.

Inspired by the United Kingdom's Church of England, a proposal has reached us about the foundation of a state-backed “Church of Hawaii” in the Anglican tradition. Although this will surely anger the followers of other Protestant branches, it will greatly please the British investors and missionaries in our realm.

The tiny atoll of Palmyra lies far to the South of our islands. Although not of significant strategic value, sending a contingent to annex it would prevent other powers from encroaching on our territorial waters.

The chain of the Hawaiian Islands expands westward across a number of tiny atolls. Chief among these is Kauihelani, or “Midway," a small atoll which may see some use as a fishing outpost or coaling station. We must annex these tiny islands to expand our kingdom.

Young King Kamehameha IV has met his end before his time. Chronically ill with the dreaded asthma, the King leaves behind a realm he tried to protect from foreign encroachment. Only his brother and heir, King Kamehameha V, can control whether the late Kamehameha's ambitions will be maintained.

In contrast to the reformists kings Kamehameha III & IV, Kamehameha V seeks to return the powers of the monarch to their traditional standing. He proposes a new constitution to increase royal powers and resurrect the abolished office of the Kuhina Nui.

“E mau ke ea o ka 'aina, Ma kou pono mau, A ma kou mana nui, E ola e ola ka mo'i .” \nSeeking to further distance ourselves from European national traditions and into a unique national identity, Princess Lili'uokalani has penned a new anthem for our kingdom. Well liked by King Kamehameha V, the sheet music of this new air has been published and spread across our isles.

The Catholic writer and historian Zepherin Kepelino Keauokalani has published a four-part compilation of Hawaiian oral histories in the native tongue, using knowledge gleaned from his family lineage of kahuna and ali'i. At a time where French and English literature has been widely distributed, native Hawaiian publishing is a source of national pride.

The steadfast and ambitious king Kamehameha V has breathed his last. A traditionalist to the end, his throne is now held by the elected King Lunalilo, a beloved figure who has been christened “the People's King”.

King Lunalilo's reign was not to last. Perpetually of poor health and chronically alcoholic, he had contracted tuberculosis not even a year into his reign. Today he has died at his private residence in Honolulu. The ambitious and daring Kalakaua has been elected in his stead, seeking to turn Hawai'i into a true power.

Foreign industrialists have encouraged the construction of small railroads to improve connections between the inland plantations on our islands and the ports. If we begin construction, we can further expand our sugar and fruit production.

American industrialist and diplomatic efforts have pressured our king into signing the "Reciprocity Treaty" with the United States, promising the Americans use of Pearl Harbor and the establishment of free trade partnership. Although the king believes this to be necessary for further investment and advancement, some Hawaiian legislators are outraged, calling it a "nation-snatching treaty."
Makua lani e, Kamehameha e, Na kaua e pale, Me ka ihe.”\nOur King Kalakaua has written a new air to our kingdom by the title of Hawai'i Pono'i", replacing the previous song by Princess Liliuokalani.

Alongside the arrival of Chinese and American workers, a new group has shown up on the plantations of Hawai'i: sugarcane workers from Portugal. Many of them hail from the Azores and Madeira, and most were initially sailors who chose to settle down overseas. They bring with them their traditional music, language, and love of malasada, a sweet baked good.

A new instrument has gained prominence in the folk music of our kingdom, inspired by the small guitars and lutes brought over by Portuguese immigrants. The ukulele is a small four-string instrument, and has seen some acclaim overseas. Many American and British musicians and instrument dealers have saught to purchase authentic ukuleles, due to their growing prominence as a Hawaiian cultural symbol and association with the Hula dance.

Many American industrial interests have taken issue with a particular cabinet minister, a man named Walter M. Gibson. A leader of a Mormon missionary group, the American-born Gibson has become a close ally of King Kalakaua, having served in so many various positions that local newspapers have dubbed him "the minister of everything." Gibson's particularly close friendship with the King has however ruffled many American feathers, as a staunch supporter of the king. A petition has recently arrived from several leading business interests, demanding his immediate removal from all governmental positions.

Ruling at threat of fire, the Honolulu Rifles have marched on the royal palace. Nearly hanging the despised minister Walter Gibson, the Rifles have forced a full cabinet shuffle, and have begun issuing demands to our king. Powerless to stop them, and with the great powers tending to support the Rifle's ambitions, our king has no choice but to agree to many of their demands...

Yet another constitution has entered into force in our kingdom. Unlike the prior sets of constitutions, it has not come from a reform movement, nor from the ambitions of our kings. Rather, the so-called "Bayonet Constitution" has been forced upon the Kingdom by the Hawaiian Rifles and a shadowy cabal of business interests known as the Citizen's Committee of Safety. Massively restricting the power of the King and repealing many of the recent reforms brought to the kingdom, our king and citizens alike fear for the future of our nation.

Prince Robert Wilcox, returned from military training in Italy, has created a new political and military organization inspired by the exploits of Garibaldi. Officially known as the Liberal Patriotic Association, the "Hawaiian Redshirts" have created quite a stir among the planters and investors, fearing a counter-coup. The LPA has received a great deal of support from the local Chinese population, who had their suffrage removed by the new constitution.

Wilcox and his redshirts have marched on the 'Iolani Palace today, backed by a small artillery battery, a hundred militiamen, and a desire to reclaim control of Hawaii from the western powers. Taking up positions around the capital, intense street fighting has begun between the Royal Guard and the redshirts. King Kalakaua, while supporting the rebellion's aims, has shown skepticism due to rumor that Wilcox intends to replace him with his sister Liliuoka.

The Royal Guard have fought valiantly, but the redshirts have emerged victorious in Honolulu, and have ordered the repeal of the Bayonet Constitution. While the plantation owners and investors look on in dismay, the uprising is greeted with great acclaim by the native and Asian immigrant populations, to whom Wilcox has become a national hero in the struggle against the foreign powers.

The Hawaiian Rifles have sprang into action and defeated Wilcox's redshirts. While the man himself has been acquitted at trial due to popular sympathies, the Big Five have preserved their influence and government and continue to curtail the strength of the monarchy.

King Kalakaua, having declining health for the past few years, has died from a stroke while traveling overseas. As a massive public funeral is arranged in Honolulu for the "Merry Monarch", his sister Liliuokalani now takes the throne as the first reigning queen of Hawaii. While the western powers circle like vultures, who knows for sure what the future holds for our nation and our queen.

Our influence in Hawaii has been threatened by a number of factors, including widespread popular support for the Monarchy against foreign investment and development. Luckily, a committee of local business interests has approached us with a proposal to annex the kingdom into our realm, requiring only material support in the overthrow of the Hawaiian queen. While these actions will surely seem uncouth on the world stage, they may be required to secure a proper hold over the Pacific.

The Committee of Public Safety, backed by local business interests and the $SPHEREMASTER$ navy, have overthrown the Hawaiian monarchy in a frightening coup d'etat. In the Kingdom's place now lies the Hawaiian Republic, a practical puppet state of the $SPHEREMASTER$. Rumor has is that the Committee of Public Safety is preparing plans for annexation...

With the overthrow of the Monarchy, the provisional government of our Republic has taken on the task of relocating all lepers within Hawaii to the isolated colony of Kalaupapa. However, anger over the forced relocation has led to a number of armed skirmishes between lepers and law enforcement, leading the Provisional Government to order the Hawaiian National Guard to remove the lepers to the colony.

Following the establishment of the Republic, the old arch-rival of the plantation classes, Robert W. Wilcox, has taken to arms again. Rallying a coalition of conspirators, elements of the former Royal Guard, and native Hawaiian laborers recruited into a militia, Wilcox aims for a final desperate struggle to restore the traditional monarchy and depose the Republic. In Honolulu ambushes have begun against police and national guard elements, and the government has been forced to assemble a citizen's militia to put down the conspirators...

Lili'uokalani reigns again in Iolani. Wilcox's conspirators have pushed out the forces of the Republic, many of who now flee to America. As the restored Royal Guard now roots out the last elements of Yankee resistance, many fear the possible response of the United States to the rebellion's victory.
After a futile attack of Wilcox's conspirators without any preparations, their forces got destroyed and our country in order.

Our King has recommended the construction of a grand new royal palace in the western style on the site of our current, fitting to the image of our modernizing kingdom. Construction will take resources, but improve the prestige and popularity of our monarchy.

'Iolani Palace has finally been completed. Following a massive investment and foreign contracting, the new building measures 23 meters tall and features an elaborate throne room and is surrounded by gardens and a large public pavilion for use in coronations and other ceremonies.

§RGain 2 infamy§! Several decades ago the Russian-American Company maintained a series of forts in the islands of Hawaii. Although we were pushed out, the Company has never truly abandoned claim to the resource-rich islands, and have at times approached the government in wishing to reclaim their control over the islands from the native monarchy. Hawaii could prove to be a valuable outpost for our empire...

Our expedition to Hawaii has ultimately not been successful. Including British and American officers, the Hawaiian Army was able to repel many of our landing parties, and those that landed were forced to retreat after several days of pitched battles and stalemates. If we wish to return to the islands, it will have to be with a large scale invasion

The forces of the Russian Tsar have invaded our kingdom. Despite our Royal Army's best efforts, the Russian marines have already landed on our shores. Already the Russian-American Company's flag flies over Honolulu. As the Russians present their treaty of annexation, our people fear for the future of our kingdom. However, not all hope is lost, for the most difficult part of Hawaii to conquer is the hinterland, and the people are ready to fight a war of attrition that may yet drive out the Russians.

Our expedition to Hawaii has been successful! The Russian-American Company flag now flies over Honolulu, and our colonial troops are rounding up the last elements of native resistance, who have taken flight to bases in the mountains and jungles. With the acquisition of the islands, Mother Russia has truly become a colonial power in her own right.

To improve the research capacity of our kingdom, it would be crucial for promising Hawaiian students (especially those from the nobility) to receive a proper education in universities in England and America. We should invest in a study abroad program for our students.\n\n§RYou need at least 70% civilization progress, the tooltip lies.§W

The Committee of Public Safety, supported by the Honolulu Rifles and American naval troops, has overthrown the rule of the Hawaiian Kingdom in a swift coup d'état following several years of unrest in the former kingdom. Some analysts say the move was precipitated by Queen Lili'uokalani's desire for a new national constitution, restoring many of the rights of the monarchy taken away by foreign pressures. Others point to the expansion of American influence in the Pacific in recent years, and a desire of the local plantation class for the benefits of direct colonial annexation. Whatever the case may be, the Kingdom of Hawaii is no more, and a Provisional Government rules in its place, preparing for its eventual annexation.

Our diplomats have sent a message to the United States Congress, asking for the annexation of the islands into the American colonial sphere. While many native elements despair at the news, many a bottle of champagne has been popped in the halls of power, as the planters await the creation of a new American territory.

The Provisional Government of Hawaii has submitted a request to our Congress to be annexed as a territory of the United States. While the jingoists and expansionists are readily accepting of this offer, elements in both major parties have expressed dismay at the concept, primarily due to the illegal nature of the recent coup d'état. While the islands have proven extremely economic valuable, and their current government is eager for annexation, taking the offer at the present moment could prove a faux pas on the international stage…

Hawaii has seen much unrest in the last decade, and although we initially turned down their annexation offer, the strategic and economic value of the islands has only grown since. With the Hawaiian government only recently having proposed annexation, us finally doing so will surely be welcomed by them.

The Americans have landed on Hawaii and demanded we sign a treaty of annexation, citing our own recent proposal to be annexed. This treaty is a sort of belated agreement on the part of the US who now recognize our government as legitimate and therefore want to go ahead with the annexation.

In a great surprise to our government, the United States has refused to accept our request for annexation. Citing the overthrow of the Hawaiian government as illegal, Minister to Hawaii James Blount has begin drafting a report into the circumstances of the coup. It will take much political and legal posturing to receive territory status now…

The United States has accepted our offer of annexation! Now the flag of the Union flies over Honolulu, and the federal government has made plans for a grand naval base to be constructed at Pearl Harbor. The days of an independent Hawaii are over, and now begins the bright new future of the Territory of Hawaii!

Following the overthrow of the monarchy, a great amount of civil unrest has broken out in the Hawaiian Islands. Domestic business fear that the unrest poses a great threat to our investments and interests in the region, and have pressured the federal government to do something about the matter. Some prominent leaders have even proposed the restoration of Queen Lili'uokalani (albeit under close American supervision) to put an end to the uncertainty on the islands.

The sudden appearance of American naval ships off the coast of Hawaii has triggered a panic among the Provisional Government. Formerly hushed fears of an American invasion have grown much stronger, and many are convinced that the Federal Government intend to depose our rule and restore the native monarchy. As word reaches us that Japan and the United Kingdom might be supporting the United States position, we may have no chance but to relent and allow for an American investigation of the coup d'etat.

American marines, supported by Japanese and British ships, have once again invaded Hawaii. But this time, they seek not to overthrow Lili'uokalani, but to restore her. The Provisional Government and the Honolulu Rifles have been pushed aside, and native government has been restored to the islands, under close American supervision.

In acquiescing to American demands of a formal investigation, the Provisional Government of Hawaii has become the Republic of Hawaii. Creating a more institutionalized model of government alongside elections and formal political parties, the Republic noticeably has restricted sufferage to only the native Hawaiians and the Yankee settler class, much to the chagrin of the immigrant workers.

Queen Liliuokalani has passed away today at the age of 79. As the people mourn the death of our longtime queen, who guided the nation through some of our darkest hours, it remains to be seen who shall now hold the throne in Honolulu. Three candidates are supported to succeed the late Queen: Theresa Owana Ka'ohelelani La'anui, David Kalakaua Kawananakoa, and Jonah Kuhio Kalaniana'ole.

Our proud king Kalaniana'ole, the 'Prince of the People', has passed away after a relatively short reign. Two possible heirs have been put forward: Theresa Owana Ka'ohelelani, head of the house of La'anui, and David Kalakaua Kawananakoa, head of the House of Kawananakoa.

Word has reached us today about the persecution of French Catholic missionaries in the remote Pacific islands of Hawaii. They have been imprisoned, beaten, and forbidden to spread the faith to the inhabitants of the islands. To the church, this cannot stand. The Foreign Ministry has proposed a naval expedition to these islands, to force the Hawaiian king to stand down and release the French prisoners.

A French gunboat has sailed to our shores today, commanded by Captain Laplace. He has sent the message that we are to immediately end our policies of persecution towards the Catholic missionaries, or face bombardment and war with France. Submitting to French demands would anger the Protestant churches, but would likely be preferable to risking a war with a great power.

Hawaii has accepted our demands: they have released the prisoners and allowed the Hawaiian Catholic Church to operate. Through this we have gained key influence in the Pacific and Captain Laplace sails back to French shores.

The Hawaiian king has refused to accept our rightful demands. Outrage has struck at the injustice, and local newspapers have published gruesome imagery of the conditions the preachers have been held in. Although an outright invasion has been called for, it may be considered overly jingoistic by the other powers to annex the islands entirely. This, however, might be the easiest chance to establish a foothold in the Pacific.

§RGain 3 infamy§! King Kalakaua has an ambitious plan - to unite the tiny kingdoms and islands of Polynesia into a single empire. To begin, we must claim the islands as our rightful territory - we shall let no foreign power lay claim to Polynesia!
With the major islands of Polynesia in our grasp, now it is time to forge a new destiny as the Kingdom of Polynesia. Our people must be united under a single banner and a single monarch!

The islands explored and settled by our ancestors must be united once more. From Madagascar to the West, to Taiwan to the North, to Aotearoa to the South, the Polynesian flag must fly. Let the other powers tremble - Polynesia rules the waves!

Following the discovery of antimony ore in the Kuching region, where this rebellion is centered, Pangeran Indera Mahkota (a representative of our great Sultanate) began to develop the territory between 1824 and 1830. When antimony production increased, we demanded higher taxes from Sarawak to maximize profit, and this has led to civil unrest and chaos. In 1839 we appointed the uncle of the sultan, Pengiran Muda Hashim, to restore order in the region. However the people of Kuching have found a newfound sympathy with the rebellion, and now go to arms to stop him… May God have mercy on the Sultanate of Brunei.
After some battles in the jungle, we have lost Simanggang to the Sarawak Rebellion. Their advance threatens the nearby city of Kuching.

After some battles in the jungle, with both camps using it to their advantage, we have lost Bintulu, the province that’s nearest to our capital, and now control all those proud Bruneians. After Pengiran Muda Hashim’s failure in the war, we could sue for peace to those merciless Sarawakans.

The Sultanate of Brunei is in conflict with the Sarawak Rebellion. Sarawak, an area with large antimony veins, has attracted British investors, bringing great profit to the Empire. To protect our interests, we could send aid to Sarawak to ensure their victory over Brunei.

After a campaign of diplomacy in London, the British are helping us defeat the filthy Sultanate of Brunei and reclaim what’s ours. This doesn’t mean they are our ally, yet we can still use their supplies that to our advantage.

Despite our efforts, the forces of Sarawak have occupied our capital and forced us to surrender control over Kuching. While we may be defeated for now, our time for vengeance against the upstart raj will surely come.

The entire Sultanate of Brunei is at the moment losing to Sarawak, which has lots of British landowners which bring profit of the antimony ore mined there to the great British Empire. So, to protect our interests we could bring the Sarawak under our inescapable sphere of influence, for them to grow with the British Empire, or help Brunei.
The “White Rajah” of Sarawak has emerged victorious against the Sultanate of Brunei. We have now carved our own realm, and may the Sultan try his very hardest to retake it!
Our Raj must expand its territory! We should demand the Sultanate of Brunei cede the region around Simanggang to our Raj, or face war.
The Raj of Sarawak has demanded we give up the region around Simanggang. This would be an outrage, but as the Raja enjoys British support, we might not have much choice in the manner…
The Sultanate of Brunei has wisely given up the territory of Simanggang to us, fearing British retribution. Our Raj marches onwards!
The foolish Sultan of Brunei has refused our demands. The obvious answer is war.
Our Raj must expand its territory! We should demand the Sultanate of Brunei cede the region around Limbang to our Raj, or face war.
The Raj of Sarawak has demanded we give up the region around Limbang. This would be an outrage, but as the Raja enjoys British support, we might not have much choice in the manner…
The Sultanate of Brunei has wisely given up the territory of Limbang to us, fearing British retribution. Our Raj marches onwards!
The foolish Sultan of Brunei has refused our demands. The obvious answer is war.

The “White Rajah” of Sarawak has requested our support in a territorial dispute against the Sultanate of Brunei. As an Englishman, it would be natural to support Sarawak’s claim, but the territory is rather remote.
The British have offered support for our rightful cause against the cruel sultan. To war we march, for our claims and conquest!
The British have refused support for our rightful cause against the cruel sultan. We can choose either to continue our plans of war, or back down.
Our Raj must expand its territory! We should demand the Sultanate of Brunei cede the region around Bintulu to our Raj, or face war.
The Raj of Sarawak has demanded we give up the region around Bintulu. This would be an outrage, but as the Raja enjoys British support, we might not have much choice in the manner.
The Sultanate of Brunei has wisely given up the territory of Bintulu to us, fearing British retribution. Our Raj marches onwards!
The foolish Sultan of Brunei has refused our demands. The obvious answer is war.

The “White Rajah” of Sarawak has requested our support in a territorial dispute against the Sultanate of Brunei. As an Englishman, it would be natural to support Sarawak’s claim, but the territory is rather remote.
The British have offered support for our rightful cause against the cruel sultan. To war we march, for our claims and conquest!
The British have refused support for our rightful cause against the cruel sultan. We can choose either to continue our plans of war, or back down.
Our Raj must expand its territory! We should demand the Sultanate of Brunei cede the region around Marudi to our Raj, or face war.
The Raj of Sarawak has demanded we give up the region around Marudi. This would be an outrage, but as the Raja enjoys British support, we might not have much choice in the manner…
The Sultanate of Brunei has wisely given up the territory of Marudi to us, fearing British retribution. Our Raj marches onwards!
The foolish Sultan of Brunei has refused our demands. The obvious answer is war.

The “White Rajah” of Sarawak has requested our support in a territorial dispute against the Sultanate of Brunei. As an Englishman, it would be natural to support Sarawak’s claim, but the territory is rather remote.
The British have offered support for our rightful cause against the cruel sultan. To war we march, for our claims and conquest!
The British have refused support for our rightful cause against the cruel sultan. We can choose either to continue our plans of war, or back down.

The English-ruled Raj of Sarawak has continued its military expansion across the northern coast of Borneo. It has traditionally enjoyed quite a close relationship with the United Kingdom, but it is currently an independent state - perhaps we could establish a protectorate over the Raj?

The United Kingdom has offered the establishment of a British protectorate over our realm. While the offer was made quite cordially, it is clear that war would be the consequence if the offer is refused…
The Rajah of Sarawak has wisely accepted our offer, and the land of Sarawak has become a protectorate of the United Kingdom.
The Rajah of Sarawak has refused to accept his status as a British subject. We should consider a military expedition to Sarawak, to “convince” the ruler otherwise.

The Raj of Sarawak has long claimed the area of Limbang. It would be to our advantage to negotiate a transfer of control of the region between them and the Sultanate of Brunei, as we have more control over the former than the latter, thus providing us with more economic control and profit.
The Raj of Sarawak has demanded we give up the region around Limbang. This would be an outrage, but as the Raja enjoys British support, we might not have much choice in the manner…
The Sultanate of Brunei has wisely given up the territory of Limbang to us, fearing British retribution. Our Raj marches onwards!
The foolish Sultan of Brunei has refused our demand to cede the area of Limbang to the Raj of Sarawak despite its legitimate claims. The obvious answer to this affront is war.

As the Bear Flag revolt of California has reached a stalemate in its conflict with Mexico, rebel leaders have proposed the ascension of the small republic to Oregon. While this would certainly invite conflict with Mexico, it would give us claims over Northern California and the vital resources therein.

While established as a neutral territory between the United States and Canada, our burgeoning republic cannot be neutral forever. We should claim the outlying territories of the region as our own, to allow for further settlement and expansion of our rising nation.
As Oregon rises as a regional power, we should expand our claims even further, to the eastern slopes of the Rocky Mountains in Montana and Wyoming, as well as to the arctic region of Yukon.

With our expansion into California, much of our population now lives outside the former Oregon Country. We should seek a new destiny as the Republic of Pacifica, and unite the lands of the west as a single nation.
Pacifica has risen as a great power in its own right, and it is just that we claim the whole of the mighty west as part of our mighty nation. Long live Pacifica!
With the independence of our proud Theodemocracy, we must claim all the territories of the Great Basin as part of our proud nation. Long live Deseret!

While our territorial expansion has been successful, there are still additional territories outside the core of Deseret that have proven of interest to Mormon settlers. We should claim these as part of our fair nation.

While many years ago the Mormons were exiled from the lands along the Missouri and Mississippi, we have never forgotten our rightful claim over the lands of the ancient Garden of Eden. The misery and pain the Americans had inflected must be avenged - all the land must rise under the banners of Zion!
Several sites in our newly conquered territories hold great importance in the Book of Mormon. We must rename these to represent the Latter Day Saints control over the Midwest.

The town currently known as Independence, Missouri was prophesied by Prophet Joseph Smith as being the site of New Jerusalem, the Millennial city to be the capital of Christendom and the site of the future Second Coming. We must fulfill the prophecy and on the site build the grandest city the Earth has ever seen.

Far to the West of Hawaii lies the tiny atoll known as Wake. Although it was never visited by our ancestors, claiming the small island could be a vital step to securing our influence over the western Pacific from the other powers.

Several decades ago, the small atoll of Sikaiana, a Polynesian enclave within the Solomon Islands, pledged their allegiance to the Hawaiian Crown. Although we have never officially acted on this claim, it has opened up the possibility of purchasing the archipelago from its current colonial owners to expand our influence to the Western Pacific.

The Kingdom of Hawaii has proposed a purchase of the remote Solomon Islands following the supposed annexation of a small atoll to their kingdom several decades prior. They offer a hefty sum for the islands, but they provide a useful economic and geopolitical outpost within the South Pacific region.

We have successfully reached a deal over the purchase of the Solomon Islands for our realm, in exchange for a hefty sum. While this may weigh on our coffers, the expansion of our rule outside of Hawaii is seen as a great victory for us on the world’s stage.

We have not been able to reach a deal over a purchase of the Solomon Islands. While the island of Sikaiana continues to claim its place as part of the Hawaiian crown, we cannot seek to effectively administer or claim it ourselves.
There is a horrific epidemic of Measles on our islands, creating a massive population loss - especially among the native Hawaiian residents of our kingdom.
There is a horrific epidemic of Measles on our islands, creating a massive population loss - especially among the native Hawaiian residents of our kingdom.
There is a horrific epidemic of Measles on our islands, creating a massive population loss - especially among the native Hawaiian residents of our kingdom.
There is a horrific epidemic of Measles on our islands, creating a massive population loss - especially among the native Hawaiian residents of our kingdom.
The Catholic Church, in addition to the various Protestant faiths, must be allowed to preach their religion. The Edict of Toleration allows the free practice of all churches in our kingdom.
King Kalakaua enjoys considerable popularity among the people, and his ambitions for a greater Polynesian kingdom might take our nation to new heights…
King Kalaniana’ole enjoys a large amount of popular support due to his promotion of traditional Hawaiian cultural policies, as well as his steadfast protection of the Hawaiian language

The federal government has embarked on a covert campaign against communist and soocialist influences in our nation through the creation of the Radical Division. Headed by Director John Edgar Hoover, the Division seeks to destroy communist infiltration internal and external.

The talks with the British have broken down, primarily due to the continuing calls by warmongering politicians. Neither of our options now is very pleasant: either we abandon our claims to Vancouver no matter what some might think, or we press ahead with the claims and brace for eventual war.
§RGain 4 infamy§! Seeing as we've restored our westernmost claims, perhaps the Greek rich regions of our formal Caucasian vassal can finally unite with the empire as well.
§RGain 3 infamy§! Seeing as we've restored our claims to our formal Caucasian vassal, perhaps the Greek rich regions of Krimaía can finally unite with the empire as well.

Colonial tensions have mounted over a dispute between British and Belgian colonial borders around the Lado Enclave. With the Belgians threatening to expand their claims over the economically valuable area, we should use our position to push Belgian influence out of Lado and the Sudd.

Britain has demanded that we give up claims to the Lado Enclave, claiming an infringement of their colonial territorial sovereignty. While this is plainly ridiculous, the large stretch of African jungle might not be worth the cost of alienating and potentially going to war against the British Empire.
The Belgians have, as expected, conceded to our demands and given up claims over the Lado territory. We have now solidified our control over the exterior regions of Sudd and Uganda.

Belgium must be led by fools. They have refused to give up claim to the Lado region despite our military posturing. Although a war with Belgium might be disastrous, the influence of Britain on the world stage relies on having the strength to back up our colonial claims.
With our victory against the foolhardy Belgians, we can assert proper British control over the disputed African territories of Lado and Wadelai, as well as parts of the northeastern Congo.
We have won, against all odds, against the British. Now we must secure and expand our claims in central Africa, so that no power may question the might of our colonial forces again!

Following the new administration of Alaska and the discovery of gold in the region, a boundary dispute has emerged over the exact borders of the Alaskan Panhandle, arising from an unclear treaty with Russians many decades ago. Tensions are high - we can try to compromise, concede to foreign claims, or take the matter directly to war.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has graciously accepted our claims in the disputed region of Alaska. While this could have been a significant dispute, we can rest easy knowing that our territorial integrity is respected by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$.

The latest attempt at mediating the long-standing Alaskan Boundary dispute between the British Dominion of Canada and our administration of Alaska has failed. Since Britain refuses to back down, if we do not abandon our claims to the disputed regions in Alaska, we may have to face the might of their armies. While $FROMCOUNTRY$ is indeed a mighty foe, and the territory in question is quite small, backing down could be a sign of weakness and a humiliation to our citizens.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us on resolving the question of the disputed border between the Stickeen and Alaska. The creation of a arbitration committee comprising American, Canadian, and British interests is the logical step forward. Of course, we could simply refuse, but risk the British pressing their claims by force.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ministry has refused to even indulge the idea of a mediated settlement. Their stubbornness leaves the issue in a continued limbo - we could concede and keep the status quo, at the loss of our claims, or take the issue to war.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to negotiate a settlement concerning the Alaska boundary dispute. They refuse to abandon their claims to the disputed regions in Alaska and we may have to face them on the field of battle. While $FROMCOUNTRY$ is indeed a mighty foe, and the territory in question is quite small, backing down could be a sign of weakness and a humiliation to our citizens.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ministry has proposed the creation of a joint $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ arbitration committee over the matter of Alaska, alongside Canadian representatives. This will, if all goes well, settle the Alaskan boundary dispute once and for all.
The Arbitration Committee has luckily accepted our claims in the Alaskan Panhandle region. However, it remains to be seen how the British react...

The Arbitration Committee has disappointingly accepted the maximal $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims over the Alaskan boundary dispute. While it would be seen as a great offense on the world stage to go to war against the Committee's decision, it would help us save face with our domestic and Canadian subjects.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have accepted the Committee’s decision with only minor disapproval. Our claimed territories in Alaska are now fully and unquestionable within our control.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have, in a flagrant violation of diplomatic norms, refused to accept the decision of the Arbitration Committee and threatened war over the disputed region of Alaska. We can back down now, but this would be seen as great cowardice.

Although not fully conceding to our claims, the arbitration committee has supported a balanced proposal that agrees, more or less, with current de facto control. While it would be seen as a great offense on the world stage to go to war against the Committee's decision, it would help us save face with our domestic subjects.

Although not fully agreeing with either our or $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ claims, the arbitration committee has supported a balanced proposal that agrees, more or less, with current de facto control. While it would be seen as a great offense on the world stage to go to war against the Committee's decision, it would help us save face with our domestic subjects.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have, in a flagrant violation of diplomatic norms, refused to accept the decision of the Arbitration Committee and threatened war over the disputed region of Alaska. We can back down now, but this would be seen as great cowardice.

$FROMCOUNTRY$, as expected, has accepted the compromise proposal of the Arbitration Committee. Although we have not gotten everything we wanted, our exact borders in the region are now clearly defined.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have, in a flagrant violation of diplomatic norms, refused to accept the decision of the Arbitration Committee and threatened war over the disputed region of Alaska. We can back down now, but this would be seen as great cowardice.
The Arbitration Committee has decided to award the Anglo-Canadian side its full claims. America has sullenly accepted the outcome, handing us the disputed strip of land as agreed upon.
The Arbitration Committee has disappointingly accepted the maximal British claims over the Alaskan boundary dispute.
The Alaskan Border Dispute: British Victory
With our victory in the Alaskan War against the Americans, we can now properly assert our claims over the disputed regions of Alaska.
The Alaskan Border Dispute: USA Victory
With our victory in the Alaskan War against the British, we can now properly assert our claims over the disputed regions of Alaska.

A small military skirmish has broken out in the San Juan Islands of the Salish Sea. An American farmer has shot a British-owned pig that had been rooting in his garden, and the situation has suddenly escalated to a tense military standoff between our two great powers. Although this situation has started from such minor circumstances, local colonial interests steadfastly demand British action in the islands, and tensions are high.

Following a local military conflict over the shooting of a British pig, the United Kingdom has agreed to cede the San Juan Islands to our Washington Territory, not wishing to start a war over the tiny isles. The humorous incident has become a folk tale in the region, and our sphere of control has been slightly expanded.

The British have approved military action over the evolving crisis in the San Juan Islands, which reportedly began over the shooting of a British pig. Although we can back down to avoid an open conflict, it would involve the cession of the San Juans to British control, and would be seen as a submissive position on the world stage. On the other hand, is a single pig worth a war?

The so-called “Pig War”, a military standoff between British and American forces on the disputed San Juan Islands, has thankfully ended without casualties (unless one counts the pig.) While we await a proper settlement of the disputed islands, both governments can breathe easy that a war between the two nations is not on the horizon.

The joint Anglo-American occupation of the San Juans has mostly continued without incident since the Pig War. However, the territory's ownership has not yet been settled on. By deferring to a neutral third party, in the form of the German Empire, we can officially resolve this dispute.

As a result of arbitration by the German Kaiser, we have been granted full control over the San Juan Islands, following a period of joint military occupation by Anglo-American forces. With our undisputed ownership of the islands, the days of American expansion in the Pacific Northwest have officially come to an end.

The United Kingdom seeks our impartial opinion on who shall receive the San Juans Islands, an archipelago off the Pacific Northwestern coast claimed by both the British and Americans. The conflict over this dispute has inflamed by the shooting of an Irishman's pig by an American settler, who sought American military protection after the incident. Now the two countries are at it again over the not-yet-finalized final border between the US and Canada. But now we have the power to decide which of these countries will have these islands.

As a result of arbitration by the German Kaiser, the United States have been granted full control over the San Juans Islands, following a period of joint military occupation by Anglo-American forces. With our undisputed ownership of the islands, the days of American expansion in the Pacific Northwest have officially come to an end.

As a result of arbitration by the German Kaiser, the United Kingdom will retain control of the San Juans Islands. The decision was made following a period of joint military occupation by Anglo-American forces. With the British having undisputed ownership of the islands, the days of American expansion in the Pacific Northwest have officially come to an end.

§RGain 3 infamy§! Now that we have achieved dominance over Scandinavia, the time has finally come to re-establish our claim to the Duchy of Estonia. King Valdemar II defeated the Estonians at the  Battle of Lindanise in 1219, planting the Danish flag firmly on Baltic soil. Our final holdout, the island of Øsel, was lost to Sweden over 400 years later in the 1645 Treaty of Brömsebro.

§RGain 3 infamy§! With our position in Dalmatia now secured, we can finally turn our eyes East once more. Venice has been deprived of its overseas dominions for too long. The time has come for us to reclaim our rightful lands! For Venice!

With the growth of our railroad system in Georgia, communities have gathered around the terminus of the Western and Atlantic Railroad near the Chattahoochee. Incorporating the area as a new city, Atlanta, will bring prosperity and growth to the as-yet rural region.

Three small settlements along the shore of Lake Michigan, Juneaustown, Kilbourntown, and Walker's Point, have grown significantly in the past few years. By incorporating these as the city of Milwaukee, we can drive new settlement to Wisconsin.

Local business, states, counties, and towns have put together a collection of roadways across the nation. By investing and formalizing these roads into a coast-to-coast “Lincoln Highway”, we can encouraging travel and the growing automotive industry in America.

Texas has declared its secession from the Union. However, they have opted not to join the Confederacy alongside the other Southern states and claim the restoration of the old Republic of Texas. While this is still a treasonous secession from the Union, an independent Texas may be less of an immediate threat to the union than the surging Confederacy.

Although Texas has seceded from the union alongside the other southern states, our governor Sam Houston has refused to consider joining the Confederacy. While much of our legislature supports the immediate ascension to union, there are still some who would prefer the restoration of the former Republic of Texas under Houston.

With the creation of German Kamerun, a dispute has launched over the small Ambas Bay colony. Germany claims the area as part of Kamerun, but a British presence in the area has existed since the 1850s. We can concede the area in exchange for a sum of gold, or we can hold steadfast and risk conflict with Germany.

The British have agreed to surrender claim to the Ambas Bay colony in exchange for a cash sum. The Kamerun colony is now free of territorial disputes, and we are free to expand the economic development of the region.

The British have refused to give up their claims to the Ambas Bay colony. Although this contradicts with our rightful claims in Kamerun, the tiny colony might not be worth a military campaign over, despite our grand imperialist ambitions…

Several missionary and trader expeditions to a region known as Ambas Bay in Cameroon have founded a small colony known as Victoria. By officially annexing the area, we can expand proper British influence in the Gulf of Guinea region.

A great stretch of rural wilderness in northwestern Wyoming has been proposed as the site of a grand “national park”. Known as the Yellowstone Valley, the essentially untouched area is home to volcanic geysers, hot springs, mountain ranges, and a plethora of flora and fauna. Protecting the area would preserve our the natural heritage of our nation.
The National Park in Yellowstone is experiencing a large tourism boom.
The National Park in Hot Springs is experiencing a large tourism boom.

The Hot Springs of Arkansas have become a legendary attraction to many across the country, with travelers far and wide arriving to indulge in the steaming hot and supposedly healing waters of the area. Protecting the area by an Act of Congress will help preserve the area for the future and boost development in the area.

While various wilderness areas have been organized under federal protection to preserve their natural beauty, there exists no single agency to manage these areas. The creation of a National Parks Service will allow us to preserve the natural beauty of America for future generations, and provide a valuable tourism opportunity in rural parts of the nation.

Socialist, Communist, and Anarchist organizing has reached a new wave in America, and elements of law enforcement have proposed in a mass campaign to arrest, try, and deport prominent activists. Although this would be seen as highly undemocratic and an overreach of the federal government’s powers by some, it may be required to protect our republic from would-be Communist revolutionaries.

Slaves whipped. Freedmen whipped. Anyone with a conviction that slavery must be gone from Cuba, whipped until near death. 

Spanish authorities, zealous in their crackdown on potential participants in a slave rebellion, whether it be actually be planned or not, have begun a campaign of terror against the Cuban population. Reports have been received that civilians are being rounded up by Spanish soldiers and then tied to a ladder, where they would be helpless against the oncoming flurry of lashings. 

Non-Cubans have also been implicated in the alleged conspiracy. The former British consul to Cuba, David Turnbull, was convicted of spearheading the conspiracy, despite him having been deported from the island two years earlier.

Following the killing of a drunk and rowdy sailor in a Honolulu jail, a mass of drunken and frenzied whalers and assorted seamen took to riot in Honolulu. Looting and burning much of the harbor, including the local police station, only a lucky wind kept the holds of whale oil themselves from combusting in flame. Citizen militias and local police eventually were able to subdue the rioters, but only after great damages across the city.

'The gale continued in all its fury until two o'clock, when it subsided. It was fearful to see the havoc during its duration. Trees were prostrate in every direction, the mill and engine house, the boiling house, the bowling alley, sugar house, cook house, two of the Chinese and one native house were down. One store house at the beach, and all the native houses there had been blown into the sea...' \nA great hurricane has hit Maui, causing damages across the region and flattening trees and houses alike.

Father Damien Jozef De Veuster, a Catholic missionary from Belgium, arrived in 1864 to preach to the poor and downtrodden, receiving considerable admiration from the populace. Known for his intense devotion to assisting the lepers, including preparing food and building infrastructure for leper colonies, his ministry has reached the hearts of many Hawaiians. Alas, he eventually contacted leprosy through his work, and has passed away following a struggle with the disease. Becoming something of a local saint, he has become known as a 'Martyr of charity' for his actions.

The great Mauna Loa volcano on the big island of Hawaii has erupted, threatening the nearby town of Hilo. Lieutenant Colonel George S. Patton, a local Air Force officer, has proposed a bombastic plan to stop the lava flow: cluster munitions, launched en masse to divert the flow of the lava to safer channels.

Lieutenant Colonel Patton's plan, against seemingly all possible odds, has worked. Hilo has been saved, as just days after the bombing the flow has apparently reversed direction completely. 7000 pounds of TNT was dropped on the volcano over six days, and the event has become something of a local folklore, with reports of locals attempting to recovering unexploded ordinance as keepsakes.

Inspired by the import of experimental films from Europe and the United States, several cartoonists and artists have founded small animation studios in Tokyo. Adapting newspaper cartoons and legends into simplistic moving pictures, these short films have found some appeal to children and theatergoers in our nascent cinema industry. They have become colloquially known as 'animeshon', a loan of an English word describing the technique of moving cartoons.

Amidst a boom of novels marketed towards women and girls, a curious subgenre known as 'Class-S' has emerged that has received outrage from conservative sectors. Usually involving romantic friendships between female students, the works tend to revolve around themes of forbidden love, melodramatic romance, and frequently suicide. Although the works have proven popular with teenage audiences, demands to curtail or ban the works have mounted, with many claiming the works portrayal of lesbian romances crosses into the obscene.

A simple children's book published in London has received international popularity. Starring a boy named Christopher Robbin and his animal friends (including the eponymous Winnie-the-Pooh, a bear), the book relays many short stories of adventures in the Hundred Acre Woods.

A cartoon has reached quite a viewership, starring the exploits of the rough and spinach-loving Popeye and his beloved sweetheart, Olive Oyl. Quickly becoming a symbol in popular culture, the 'Popeye' character has been featured in many newspapers, advertisements, and songs alike.

A new sugary beverage has swept across the nation in recent years. Invented by a Confederate veteran by the name of John Pemberton and bottled in Vicksburg, Coca-Cola, named for its primary ingredients (cocaine and kola nut), has captured the taste-buds of much of our country, and has become something of a luxury good overseas, where carbonated beverage production has proven less common.

A highly unique medical research institute has been founded in Berlin by Magnus Hirschfeld. Dubbed the Institut für Sexualwissenschaft ('Institute of Sexology'), the Institute has become a self-described safe haven for homosexuals and transsexuals in Germany. The Institute has become an outspoken advocate for the rights of homosexuals, supporting a radical social program including advocating for the public acceptance of homosexuality, medical care for the sex reassignment of transsexual patients, and the existence of a 'third gender' outside of male and female. Frequently subject to vandalism by right wing elements, the Institute has become a flashpoint in the evolving social environment of this new Berlin.

A far right student organization associated with the NSDAP has attacked and demolished the controversial Institute of Sexology, known for their steadfast defense of the rights of homosexuals and transsexuals. A book burning of the Institute's library has taken place in the Opernplatz, and many of the Institute's faculty and patients have been taken to prisons and labor camps, or disappeared entirely. As the smoke rises over Berlin, one cannot help but feel another flame has been snuffed out.

An illustrator named Gerda Wegener has become something of a celebrity within art circles in Denmark. Known for her colorful Art Nouveau paintings, usually depicting tender scenes between women, Wegener has adopted an extravagant bohemian lifestyle alongside her husband.

The famed portrait artist Gerda Wegener has revealed that her longtime female model has been her own supposed husband, Mr. Wegener. Wegener has put forward a petition with our government requesting a change of name to Lili Ilse Elvenes, and a change of sex to female. While transvestites are nothing new to Copenhagen, changing the legal sex of a citizen has never been performed in any European state, or perhaps any state whatsoever. \nLili and her wife have great cultural influence within the art world, and the issue has become a sensation in German and Danish newspapers. We could allow the change, but this would spark great unrest due to the technical allowance of a homosexual marriage. Alternatively, we could annul the marriage through an act of the government, and allow the marriage to go through following this.

An Okinawan activist and businessman named Kyuzo Toyama has organized large scale immigration from Okinawa to our islands. With the islands experiencing economic woes and recession, many immigrants have come with Kyuzo to work in the plantation industry. However, this migration has not been well-received by the rest of the local Japanese community, who have degraded and insulted many an Okinawan migrant, viewing them as backwards and clueless.

A group of Japanese immigrants have come to our kingdom, seeking employment in the sugarcane plantations. Known as the 'Gannenmono', the 'first-year-people', they have become the foundation of the Japanese community in our islands, and bring with them their cuisine and culture to the fabric of Hawai'i

Three of our young princes, on their educational journey abroad, have introduced our traditional sport of surf-riding to the United States. Traditionally only enjoyed by Polynesians, the practice of lying or standing upright on boards amidst the ocean waves has appealed to some British and American tourists. They have come to a stretch on O'ahu known as Waikiki to enjoy the ancient past-time alongside native Hawaiian surfers. Some have even returned to start surfing clubs along the coast of California.

Japanese immigrants to our islands have brought a new dish, known as Shave Ice. Inspired by the traditional desert of Kakigori, shave ice has become a favorite among plantation workers of all nationalities. Made simply by shaving a block of ice into fine shards and then flavoring it with sweet syrups, the desert has become a Hawaiian culinary symbol for those hot humid days.

Inspired by the Vaquero traditions of Mexico, a unique culture of cattle farming has arisen on the Big Island of Hawaii. Calling themselves Paniolo, these horseback riders having taken to many cowboy and vaquero traditions from the Americas, and even spread the Mexican-American sporting event of Rodeo to the island.

Following the untimely death of King Lunalilo, a contentious royal election has begun. The three primary candidates are Prince David Kalakaua, Queen Consort Emma Kaleleokalani, and Lady Bernice Pauahi Bishop, all once classmates at the Royal School. Prince Kalakaua is a nativist and intensely supports the economic and political sovereignty of Hawaii
French: Queen Emma is outspokenly Pro-British, and Bernice Bishop prefers a strong relationship with the Americans. Out of all the candidates, Emma and Kalakaua enjoy the most support, and conflicts are high going into the royal election.

English: Following the election of King Kalakaua to the throne of Hawaii, the Emmaites (supports of Queen Emma’s candidacy) have rioted during the official counting of votes for the Royal Election. Attacking Kalakaua’s supporters and vandalizing the Honolulu Courthouse, the riot was only put down by the combined forces of British and American marines, alongside local Hawaiian police and militia. Thirteen legislators were severely injuried, with one, Representative Lonoaea, dying from his injuries. Although Emma herself condemned the violence, the Emmaites stay militant and continue demanding her installation.

Her majesty Queen Kaleleokalani, better known as “Queen Emma”, has passed away. A strong supporter of British economic investment in Hawaii, in her death the British have proposed the creation of an official protectorate encompassing the Hawaiian Islands. While King Kalakaua assumes the throne, it is unclear in what capacity he shall govern.

The death of the pro-British Queen Emma Kaleleokalani has created a power vacuum in the island kingdom of Hawaii. Several of our foreign ministers have proposed the use of this opportunity to create a British protectorate over the islands, but this may incur some minor grumbling from the other powers with interests in the Pacific region.

Our Queen Pauhai has passed away today in Honolulu. Beloved by the common people for her philanthropy and the capitalists for her pro-American stance, her death and the resulting of succession of King Kalakaua has put our kingdom into an awkward position. It is very likely that the Americans will expand their political influence in the islands to prevent losing their economic expansion cultivated under the late Queen. These may be dark days for Hawaii…
After the USA's pacification of our territory, our Monarchy has been restored and the Red, white and blue flies again over the 'Iolani Palace.

With our freedom secured, Queen Lili'uokalani has proposed a new constitution for our Kingdom rolling back the Bayonet Constitution and restoring the rights of the 1864 Constitution. Granting women's suffrage, minority rights, greater executive power to the Monarchy, and curtailing the authority of the Big Five, the constitution will be seen as a restoration of Hawaiian sovereignty.

With our economic destitution following the war of independence against Spain, instability and civil wars, the lack of foreign investment and the inability to acquire loans, we were long unable to search for rumored deposits of valuable veins of iron and coal. Now that we've gained significant standing on the international stage and have sufficient capital to invest in prospecting, perhaps it is time to begin the exploration and exploitation of our underdeveloped resources.

A earthquake struck the Croatian city of Zagreb today at 7:33 AM. The tremor and its small aftershocks have wrought destruction on many local buildings. Most tragically, the Zagreb Cathedral was severely damaged, with its nave suffering collapse and the tower destroyed beyond repair. The human toll, on the other hand, is miraculously small--only one person has been confirmed dead.

President Nicolás de Perola's betrayal of his promise to implement a federal system in Peru has sparked a rebellion in Loreto. The general Ricardo Seminario y Aramburú, amassing a militia for the cause, has declared the Federal State of Loreto as an integral part of Peru. Locals are showing strong support for this effort due to the government's neglect of the Department, despite its economic importance due to the rubber boom.

500-800 Cretan Christians of the city of Candia have been massacred by our forces. This outbreak of violence was motivated by Western powers' recent condemnation concerning our treatment of Christians on Crete. Muslim irregulars burnt part of the city and, over the course of four hours, slaughtered Christian civilians by the hundreds. \n\nThe massacre will certainly cause a swift, decisive and united international response, incurring upon us the wrath of the Western powers.

The so-called "Pig War" against the British has ended, in our favor. We could take this opportunity to claim the whole of Vancouver Island and the Queen Charlotte Islands, both known for their wealth in timber and minerals.

The so-called 'Pig War' against the Americans has ended, in our favor. We should take this opportunity to expand our control to the whole of the Puget Sound region, valuable for fishing and agricultural development.

Starvation and hypothermia are wracking the residents and livestock of North America in this particularly lethal winter. When snow came earlier than expected and fell in unprecented amounts, cow pastures were destroyed and cattle ended up starving to death. Human inhabitants, meanwhile, are reported to have been frequently dying to hypothermia and frostbite. The weather has spread across the entire continent--even leading to snowfall in San Francisco. All we can ask: when will it end?

A severe earthquake hit Guatemala today at around 9:30 PM. With its epicenter around the village of Patzicía, the tremor damaged communities in Amatitlán, Escuintla, Chimaltenango and Antigua Guatemala. \n\nIt also completely destroyed the village of Parramos, whose inhabitants had no choice but to relocate their homesteads 3-and-a-half kilometers south of the original settlement. Armed bandits also contributed to the villagers' flight by robbing them of the few remaining possessions they had after their homes' destruction. Fortunately, authorities later arrested and summarily executed the bandits.

An earthquake has struck the province of Esmeraldas. The tremor's magnitude has caused serious damage to local communities as well as generating tsunamis reaching Colombia, Costa Rica, Mexico, Hawaii, and even Japan.

An earthquake rocked Ecuador and southern Colombia yesterday, causing severe damage. The seismic center formed near El Ángel, Carchi province, and aftershocks persisted for 24 hours.
